summary: This document is an email forwarded within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) on July 12, 2021. It contains a first-person account from a woman describing being sexually harassed by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell on a commercial flight when she was between 12 and 14 years old. The witness details the harassment, the lack of assistance from flight staff, and Maxwell's role as an enabler.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary harasser who switched seats to sit next to the underage witness, showed her pictures of his wealth, made inappropriate advances, and grabbed her arm despite being told her age and to stop.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's companion and protector. She initially made a scene at the gate, secured a seat next to the witness, and later became angry and abusive when the witness asked for her help, denying she was Epstein's wife and telling the witness to go back to her seat.

persons.name: l=a
persons.context: The author of the email. She describes being a minor (12-14 years old) traveling alone when she was harassed by Epstein and Maxwell on a flight. She sought help from flight attendants and Maxwell but was ignored and dismissed.

connections.description: Described as traveling together and acting as a team to harass the witness. Maxwell is characterized as Epstein's 'protector' who encouraged and helped him.
Epstein is described as sexually harassing the underage witness on a flight, persisting after being told her age and to stop, and grabbing her arm.
Maxwell is described as enabling the harassment, securing a seat next to the witness, and responding abusively when the witness asked for her help.

events.title: In-flight Harassment of Minor
events.description: A witness (then aged 12-14) was sexually harassed by Jeffrey Epstein on a commercial flight, with Ghislaine Maxwell's involvement. The witness sought help from flight attendants and Maxwell but was ignored and told to endure it because Epstein was 'a powerful man with influence'.

events.title: Witness Email to Prosecutors
events.description: A witness emailed the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to provide an account of her harassment by Epstein and Maxwell in the 1990s, stating the experience caused her permanent damage.

keyFacts: A witness provides a first-hand account of being sexually harassed by Jeffrey Epstein as a minor (12-14 years old) on a commercial flight in the 1990s, with Ghislaine Maxwell present and participating.
Flight attendants refused to help the witness, telling her Epstein was 'a powerful man with influence' and she should just endure the short flight, despite her stating she was underage.
When the witness confronted Ghislaine Maxwell for help, Maxwell became angry and abusive, denied being Epstein's wife, and told the witness to 'go back to your seat' and 'get over yourself'.
The witness characterizes Maxwell as Epstein's 'protector' who was 'in control the whole time' and needs to be held accountable for her role in the abuse.
The correspondence was forwarded within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on July 12, 2021, during Maxwell's prosecution.
